original: Erichs, Malte Harald, länsarkitekt, Huskvarna, f. 28/3/88 i Bred, Upps. 1., av kyrkoh. J. A. Erikson o. Anna Maria Djurson. G. 1. 16-43 m. Signe Källman; 2. 44 m. Gerd Erikson. Barn: Sverker f. 17, Karin 20. — Mog:ex. v. norra real i Sthlm 07, KTH (A) 07-11, konsthögsk. 12-14. Stud:res. t. Tyskl. o. Österr. 13. Anst. h. prof. I. G. Clason o. Grut, överlär. v. tekn. sk. i Sthlm 16-17, anst. v. Gbgs stadsing :kont. 17-20, prakt, ar-kit. i Gbg 20’-27, arkit. i byggn:styr. 27, å byggn:styr. stadsplanebyrå 27- 28, länsarkit. i Jönköp. o. Östergötl. 1. 28-38, (v. distr. uppdeln.) länsarkit. i Jönköp. 1. fr. 38. KN02kili, RVO, Haia-kon VII :s FrK.
translated: Erichs, Malte Harald, county architect, Huskvarna, born March 28, 1888 in Bred, Uppsala County, son of Rev. J. A. Erikson and Anna Maria Djurson. Married first to Signe Källman in 1916 and second to Gerd Erikson in 1944. Children: Sverker born in 1917 and Karin born in 1920. Completed secondary education at Norra Real in Stockholm in 1907, studied at Royal Institute of Technology (Architecture) from 1907-1911, and at the School of Arts from 1912-1914. Received a scholarship for study trips to Germany and Austria in 1913. Employed at the Royal Institute of Technology under Prof. I. G. Clason and Grut, and then as a senior lecturer at the technical school in Stockholm from 1916-1917, employed at Gothenburg's city building office from 1917-1920, practised architecture in Gothenburg from 1920-1927, worked for building supervision from 1927, at the building control city planning office from 1927-1928, appointed county architect in Jönköping and Östergötland in 1928-1938, (district subdivision) then became the county architect in Jönköping starting from 1938. Knight of the Order of the North Star, holder of the Royal medal "Haia-kon VII's FrK".
